instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Hi , ive got and <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image, laptop had water damage, as far as i can tell <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> is not being told to turn the screen on, on pin 1 <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> i get 0v,  diode reading is .496 so it dosnt seam to be shorting , pin 2 and 3 i get 3.3v , gpu vcore is at .085v so im guessing thats on, any clues where to go from here?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: What about chime, or USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
First, 3V at pin4 of J9000?
If not, check L9008.

Pins 6 & 7 should have aprox 3V and same resistance to ground; less than 1% difference.
If not, check <RESISTOR>R9008</RESISTOR>/09.

I suppose you have missing backlight too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Hi yes i have 3v at pin 4 and 3v at pin 6 and 7 and resistance is the same on both pins and yes no backlight either, and just to put it in there cause i didnt say originally (my bad) , i have tested with a known good screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Check diode mode on the same pins at the end of a separate LCD cable to confirm the connector is not bad.
